unnormalised: **Quora Post: Home Loan Schemes - Help a brotha out!**
normalised: **Quora Post: Home Loan Schemes - Help a brother out!**

unnormalised: Hey folks in the Real Estate & Property corner of Quora,
normalised: Hey folks in the Real Estate and Property corner of Quora,

unnormalised: So, yours truly, Rahul Sharma from Delhi, is finally taking the plunge and buying a house! Exciting times, but also kinda scary, especially when trying to navigate the maze of home loan schemes.
normalised: So, yours truly, Rahul Sharma from Delhi, is finally taking the plunge and buying a house! Exciting times, but also kind of scary, especially when trying to navigate the maze of home loan schemes.

unnormalised: Seriously, ICICI Bank, HDFC, SBI... the options are overwhelming! Fixed rate, floating rate, hybrid... I'm drowning in jargon.
normalised: Seriously, I C I C I Bank, H D F C, S B I... the options are overwhelming! Fixed rate, floating rate, hybrid... I'm drowning in jargon.

unnormalised: Anyone out there recently taken a home loan and can share their experience? Specifically, I'm looking at a loan of around Rs. 50 Lakhs for a property in Gurgaon, about 15 km from my current place.
normalised: Anyone out there recently taken a home loan and can share their experience? Specifically, I'm looking at a loan of around rupee fifty lakh for a property in Gurgaon, about fifteen kilometer from my current place.

unnormalised: What schemes are worth considering? Any hidden charges I should be aware of? Is a longer tenure (say, 25 years) always the best option, or is it better to bite the bullet and go for a shorter one, even if the EMIs are higher?
normalised: What schemes are worth considering? Any hidden charges I should be aware of? Is a longer tenure (say, twenty five years) always the best option, or is it better to bite the bullet and go for a shorter one, even if the E M I's are higher?

unnormalised: My salary is decent, around Rs. 70,000 per month, but I also want to keep some aside for, you know, enjoying life and eating delicious biryani on the weekends!
normalised: My salary is decent, around rupee seventy thousand per month, but I also want to keep some aside for, you know, enjoying life and eating delicious biryani on the weekends!

unnormalised: Also, considering Diwali is just around the corner, any banks offering special festive deals? Heard some rumblings about SBI having a promo, but not sure if it's worth it.
normalised: Also, considering Diwali is just around the corner, any banks offering special festive deals? Heard some rumblings about S B I having a promo, but not sure if it's worth it.

unnormalised: Any advice from experienced homebuyers (especially fellow Indians!) would be massively appreciated. Help a brotha make the right decision! Thanks in advance!
normalised: Any advice from experienced homebuyers (especially fellow Indians!) would be massively appreciated. Help a brother make the right decision! Thanks in advance!
